title: Ticket #2961: Roadmap for v7.9 development series
description:
Note: For each item, need to create/add links to design documents and subtickets

Enhancement items on the radar from UW

UW Mission-Critical Priority

  1. Streaming CE.
  2. Continue work on Partitionable Slots. (#3241)
  3. BOSCO File Transfer. Provide explicit job sandbox movement operations to move files in the event that a schedd does not share a file system with the head (submit) node of a cluster where the blahp is launched. (#2386)

UW High Priority

  1. Remove barriers that prevent Condor-C from serving as a CE #1376
  2. Ckpt in Vanilla Universe. #2007
  3. Local Universe jobs managed via a Startd co-located alongside the Schedd. Essentially Local Universe as Vanilla Universe jobs with an additional requirement. #3019
  4. Tool so admin can ask the local startd what is happening. Simple command-line tool geared towards a Condor-ignorant system administrator that would contact the local startd and report who is using the machine from where. Similar to Unix's who; maybe a condor_who anyone ? #3046
  5. Glideins: Startd chirps back job starts and completions to the job log on submit node.
  6. Homogenize Condor-G error codes (hold reason codes) into categories.
  7. Offload File Transfer from submit machine, via either transferd (as described in bosco file transfer design document) and/or leveraging http proxies.

UW Medium Priority

  1. Interactive Jobs. Leverage ssh_to_job functionality to provide a way for users to request for an interactive shell session to be scheduled on an execute machine. #3088
  2. GPU Support. Have Condor auto-discover NVIDA CUDA GPU resources, publish operational information on these GPUs in machine ClassAd. Sandbox GPU devices so they are only accessible to the job in which they were allocated. Allow GPUs to work w/ partitionable slots.
  3. Overlap file transfer w/ computation. Allow another job to be launched on the same resource while a starter is busy sending back the output sandbox from a previous job. This work is 80%+ completed on a branch; Fermi is expecting this functionality to make it into v7.9.x as they contributed Parags time last year. In hindsight, I think we made a mistake when we made this work dependent upon hierarchical claims/resource bundles, and instead should pursue the relatively straightforward original idea of allowing the schedd to have multiple activations per claim.
  4. Job Sandboxing. Continue leveraging Linux kernel mechanisms to provide better isolation between slots on the same machine. In particular, in v7.9 interested in providing better Memory (RAM usage) isolation between slots.
  5. DAGMan will use its own event log file. We could avoid DAGMan problems with file descriptor throttles and more by changing the schedd, shadow, and condor_submit to allow a job to have more than one user log file. So the user could specify whatever log file they wanted in their submit file, but DAGMan wouldn't pay any attention to that file. Instead, DAGMan could specify its own event log file in addition to the user-specified files. That way, DAGMan would only need to read a single log file, and we could solve a bunch of problems at one shot. This would also avoid "polluting" the per-job user logs with POST SCRIPT TERMINATED events. (#2807)
  6. Secure by default.
  7. IPv6/IPv4 mixed pools.
  8. Minimize Code Paths.
  9. Support for Run as Root.
  10. Multiple jobs per Shadow.
  11. Operational Metrics for people who shower. CondorView is limited and very long in the tooth. Now that we have a mechanism for statistics, the idea is a basic way to present them via a web browser without the need for geeky command-line tools; similar to the usage graphs provided by glideinWMS.
    • Potentially relevant:
      • Red Hat's contrib module: Plumage - Collector ClassAd data into MongoDB
      • #594: CondorView collector should track arbitrary fields - Presumably we'll want to see historic data, not just instantaneous. Someone needs to keep the old data. The collector does this today (in very limited ways!)
      • #595: Store CondorView database in more generic format
      • #596: Serve CondorView data via SOAP (or other HTTP) interface
      • #597: New CondorView user interface
    • Various statistics we might be interested in (noted as documentation hasn't entirely caught up):
      • #2197: General statistics architecture for Condor - See derived tickets
      • #2006: RFE: publish some additional performance-related stats in schedd ad
  12. Allow transfer_output_remaps to work with sub-directories.
  13. Better blackhole detection - we can do smarter things than this recipe by involving the startd (or matchmaker?) such that each job need not discover the blackhole on its own.

Enhancement items on the radar from Red Hat

  1. Combine Collector/Negotiator #3007
  2. Collector/Negotiator/ClassAd performance work #2541 DONE
  3. PSlots #2826 #3435
  4. Delta Cloud Mods
  5. Move to standards #3096 (General cleanup, readability, and perf)

Packaging/Testing items on the radar from UW

#3154

  1. Clear/reliable mechanism to invoke the test suite outside of NMI. End users (aka Debian) should be able to run the suite.
  2. Improve reliability and performance of test suite. Explicit notification feedback for consumption by functional tests.
  3. Address packaging divergence.
  4. Enhance coverage of tests, especially run-as-root tests.
